channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Spain Braces for More Rain and Flooding as Rescuers Dig Through Debris
item.description: The authorities said dozens of people were still missing, as forecasters warned of new flooding in the southwest.

item.title: Trial of Daniel Penny in Subway Killing Begins With Opening Statements

item.title: Hurricanes and strikes limit US payroll gains to just 12,000, but jobless rate steady at 4.1%

item.title: How the U.S. Election Matters for the Rest of the World
item.description: Times foreign correspondents describe what’s at stake for the world, including China, Israel, Ukraine, global trade and climate.

item.title: Spain Flash Floods: Scenes From the Deluge
item.description: Flash flooding across Spain killed more than 150 people after torrential rain left towns and villages submerged and turned streets into rivers.

item.title: More than 60% of CEOs are ‘digitally illiterate’, according to their own employees
item.description: Employees say they're losing nearly 6 hours a week to laborious tasks because their bosses aren't automating.

item.title: Strokes are on the rise, especially in younger people. These 5 lifestyle changes can help lower your risk
item.description: Strokes are the No. 5 cause of death in the U.S.—and they’re on the rise.

item.description: The storm’s hurricane-strength winds uprooted trees and made it difficult for planes to land.
